This is good
This is juuust right

ANTHRO 1150.Title: Ancient Landscapes
Reviews: Pretty insightful
This is kinda meh

ANTHRO 1231.Title: Life in the Pleistocene
Reviews: Interesting, good professor

ANTHRO 1255.Title: Human Diet: from Neanderthals to the future of food
Reviews: Small seminar-style class, very well-taught

Lots of work, but very rewarding

APMTH 201.Title: Physical Mathematics I
Reviews: Lots of work
Pretty well taught
Sections are fun!

APMTH 230.Title: Active Matter
Reviews: Not the best
Very difficult

APMTH 318.Title: Special Topics in Physical Mathematics

APMTH 326.Title: Theoretical Neuroscience and Neural Computation
Reviews: Bruh Professor Xavier is the worst!
TERRIBLE CLASS, never take EVER
This is the worst class I've ever taken

AFVS 10F.Title: Indelible, Irrepressible: Drawing Course
Reviews: Drawing courses here are underappreciated!
Take this course!!!

AFVS 40H.Title: Introduction to Still Photography
Reviews: Very niche topic but well-executed
I was a complete beginner to photography but this class taught me so much
I met some of my closest friends during this class

AFVS 76.Title: The Language of Modern Art
Reviews: Great introduction to modern and contemporary art
TAKE THIS CLASS! Even if you are new to art/humanities

AFVS 158AR.Title: Sensory Ethnography 1
Reviews: Not worth the time
Interesting, but not taught well at all

ASTRO 17.Title: Galactic and Extragalactic Astronomy
Reviews: Super cool topic
Great introduction to this field if you're at all interested

ASTRO 110.Title: Exoplanets
Reviews: Niche topic that is taught pretty well
Exoplanets are so cool, and Prof. Johnson makes this class so worth it
Not too much work, and lectures are really interesting
Exams are fair, problem sets are doable, and the class is interesting

ASTRO 300.Title: Topics in Modern Astrophysics
Reviews: Grad-student heavy class, but rewarding for undergrads too
Very applicable to many fields of research
Prof Chen is a GOD - take this class!

BME 130.Title: Neural Control of Movement
Reviews: Cannot believe this class is required for the bioengineering major. TERRIBLE
DO NOT TAKE if you don't need to. Sadly, many will need to
Prof. Smith shows up late to class every day and is so disorganized

BME 131.Title: Neuroengineering
Reviews: Difficult, but rewarding
Interesting content but it's a bit too specialized
Definitely go to office hours, and then you'll be fine

CHEM 17.Title: Principles of Organic Chemistry
Reviews: I hate orgo.
Orgo is so hard, but Prof. Brunker is great and helpful
MAKE FRIENDS in this class or you will die!
DONT. FALL. BEHIND.

CHEM 27.Title: Organic Chemistry of Life
Reviews: It's orgo, what can you expect.
Better than 1st semester orgo, but not fab

CHEM 100R.Title: Experimental Chemistry and Chemical Biology
Reviews: A LOT of time, but definitely so worth it
You learn so many new chem techniques to use in the lab
TAKE THIS CLASS - it's been my favorite class so far and highly recommend.

CHEM 160.Title: The Quantum Mechanics World
Reviews: Ew.
So poorly taught, and exams are so unnecessarily difficult
Pretty well taught, but the material itself is just so hard

CHEM 311.Title: Physical Chemistry
Reviews: PChem is just a lot of math, so keep that in mind before taking it
Lieber is a genius, so make sure you go to his office hours
Mainly a grad class, but definitely doable for undergrads too

CHEM 326.Title: Atomic Physics and Organometallic Chemistry
Reviews: Such a good class! Very low workload for a chem class.
Great way to satisfy your chemistry upper elective requirement

CMPLIT 108.Title: Translating World Literature
Reviews: Very interesting topic that isn't taught too often

CMPLIT 162.Title: Homer and Beyond: Theory and Comparative Methods in Studying Oral Traditions
Reviews: I never know Homer could be so interesting!!
Nagy isn't the best but this class is bearable at least

COMPSCI 50.Title: Introduction to Computer Science
Reviews: Iconic class
A bit overhyped ngl...
Too much like a performance, and too little teaching

COMPSCI 51.Title: Abstraction and Design in Computation
Reviews: OCAML is kinda useless
I really liked this class but it's definitely a hot take
terrible...

COMPSCI 61.Title: Systems Programming and Machine Organization
Reviews: Very difficult
Exams are impossible. You were warned...

COMPSCI 105.Title: Privacy and Technology
Reviews: Very useful course

COMPSCI 124.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms
Reviews: A BEAST of a class, but unfortunately a hard requirement

COMPSCI 181.Title: Machine Learning
Reviews: This class is SO much math. Brush up on your calc...
So difficult, and not even taught that well.

CHIN BA.Title: Elementary Modern Chinese
Reviews: This class is taught so well, and really generates a sense of community. A MUST TAKE for your language requirement!
Du laoshi is the best ever - so chill and so helpful always

CHIN BB.Title: Elementary Modern Chinese 2
Reviews: Much more difficult than Chinese BA, but still very rewarding.
You come out of this class knowing SO much Chinese!

CHIN 123XB.Title: Intermediate Modern Chinese for Advanced Beginners
Reviews: Such a fun class!
A must take!!

KOR BA.Title: Elementary Korean
Reviews: I LOVED this class!!
Truly a gem. Please take this for your language requirement
The teaching staff of this class really wants everyone to succeed

KOR BB.Title: Elementary Korean 2
Reviews: A great continuation of Korean BA
Take this class if you want to learn more about Korean culture

ECON 10A.Title: Principles of Economics (Microeconomics)
Reviews: A mediocre introduction to economics.
Not the best, but Laibson and Furman are two of the best economists out there

ECON 10B.Title: Principles of Economics (Macroeconomics)
Reviews: A logical continuation of Ec 10a, but maybe a little harder.
Prof Maggi isn't as great at Laibson or Furman, but still pretty great

ECON 50.Title: Using Big Data to Solve Economic and Social Problems
Reviews: A MUST TAKE! Raj Chetty is the best and you learn so much in this class.
Lectures can be a bit dry sometimes but psets and exams are so manageable.

ECON 980B.Title: Education in the Economy
Reviews: Such a great class!
It says Econ 1010A is a prereq for this class, but you don't really need it

ECON 1010A.Title: Intermediate Microeconomics
Reviews: Too much math in this class, and pretty poorly taught too.
Sad that this is a required course for the econ degree.

ECON 1010B.Title: Intermediate Macroeconomics
Reviews: Better taught than Econ 1010A, but still not ideal.

ECON 1017.Title: A Libertarian Perspective on Economic and Social Policy
Reviews: Worst class I've taken. Boring, difficult, poorly taught
Exams are unfairly hard even though the rest of the class gives off chill vibes
Problem sets are so unrepresentative of the exam difficulty
I wish I had not taken this time-sink of a class

ECON 1123.Title: Introduction to Econometrics
Reviews: One of the better econ classes on campus

ENGSCI 53.Title: Quantitative Physiology as a Basis for Bioengineering
Reviews: So disorganized, but cool content.
This class needs a new teaching staff and then it'll be so much better

ENGSCI 94.Title: Entrepreneurship and Innovation
Reviews: Interesting topic, pretty well taught.
No exams, no quizzes is a huge pro

ENGSCI 112.Title: Thermodynamics
Reviews: MUCH better alternative to ENGSCI 181, but still not amazing.
Prof Martin is so funny and really tries to engage his students, but sometimes he soes come off seeming a bit clueless or disorganized

ENGSCI 151.Title: Applied Electromagnetism
Reviews: Terribly taught
I went into this class interested in E&M and came out of it traumatized

ENGL CIJR.Title: Introduction to Journalism: Workshop
Reviews: Such a good class, but unfortunately is lotteried.
Take this even if you aren't a humanities major!

ENGL CTV.Title: Writing for Television: Developing the Pilot: Workshop
Reviews: Very niche and interesting topic.

ENGL 350.Title: Teaching and Professional Development Colloquium
Reviews: Small, seminar-style class but without an enrollment cap.
Very useful skills and Prof Miller is fantastic

ENVIRO 90P.Title: Climate Responsibility and Climate Action
Reviews: Such important content is covered in this class!
Everything from global warming to fossil fuels and policy is covered here.

ENVIRO 168.Title: Human Environmental Data Science
Reviews: So hard, and exams are impossible.
Be prepared to code A LOT for this class

GOV 40.Title: International Conflict and Cooperation
Reviews: Amazing class!
Prof Chaudoin is such a great lecturer

GOV 93CJ.Title: Criminal Justice Policy Practicum
Reviews: Not too heavy of a workload, yet very rewarding.
Just attend lecture and you'll already get so much out of this class.

GOV 94JH.Title: American Cyber Politics
Reviews: Very niche subject that is actually quite important for politics.
Worth taking as a gov elective.
Highly recommend!

GOV 1759.Title: Behavioral Insights and Public Policy: Nudging for Good
Reviews: HUGE class, so you don't get much professor interaction.
There's so little work in this class, but it's still quite interesting.

HIST 15G.Title: Resistant Masculinity
Reviews: Great class, but lotteried.
Lottery for this class!
Such an important topic to debate and discuss with others

HIST 1029.Title: Early Modern Britain, 1485-1714
Reviews: There are too many readings in this class.
Beware that Prof Cratty gives pop quizzes!

HIST 1513.Title: History of Modern Latin America
Reviews: Good introduction to contemporary Latin American culture.

HIST 2445.Title: Constitutions, Law, and Empire
Reviews: Lots of reading in this class.
Take this class if you're interested in policy and law-making

LING 101.Title: The Science of Language: An Introduction
Reviews: Good and painless way to satisfy the humanities requirement.
Linguistics is so interesting and this is a great intro to the field

LING 212.Title: Syntactic Theory
Reviews: Pretty interesting, and applicable as well.
Useful for anyone to learn as a skill set.

MATH 19A.Title: Modeling and Differential Equations for the Life Sciences
Reviews: Interesting take on mathematics specifically for uses in the life sciences.

MATH 22B.Title: Vector Calculus and Linear Alebra
Reviews: So much busy work, but definitely useful skills to have.
3 psets per week and 3 midterms is too much

MATH 101.Title: Sets, Groups, and Real Analysis
Reviews: Taught incredibly well for such a difficult topic.
Professor Chen is a magician.
Loved this class!

MATH 230A.Title: Differential Geometry
Reviews: Super difficult topic, but pretty well executed.
Not that much work for an upper level math class

MOLBIO 60.Title: Cellular Biology and Molecular Medicine
Reviews: Honestly a terrible introduction to biology.
Could have been executed better.

MOLBIO 66.Title: Pathological Cell Biology
Reviews: Interesting applications, and pretty well taught.
Great class for premeds to take for context

MOLBIO 112.Title: Biological Data Analysis
Reviews: Prof Eddy is the best and truly a genius.
This class is probably the best at Harvard
So much work, but very very worth it

NEURO 80.Title: Neurobiology of Behavior
Reviews: Great intro to neuro for students of any background.
Take this class!
Very helpful content, especially for MCAT prep

NEURO 101TB.Title: The Neuroscience of Addiction
Reviews: Sounds more interesting than it is.

PHIL 27.Title: Truth, Lies, and the Press
Reviews: For a philosophy class, I thought it was genuinely very interesting.
Prof Siegel really loves discussions, and it helps the learning process

PHIL 109.Title: Early Chinese Ethics
Reviews: Not very much work, but still not taught well.
Not really worth taking, look for a different phil class for your requirement

PHIL 186.Title: Feminism in the Arts and Sciences
Reviews: Small seminar-style class that's very engaging.
Covers such a relevant and important topic!

PHYS 15A.Title: Introductory Mechanics and Relativity
Reviews: Very difficult but you learn so much physics from this.
Hard, but accessible physics for someone of any level.

PHYS 15B.Title: Introductory Electromagnetism
Reviews: Significantly harder than Physics 15A
Too difficult for someone who hasn't taken AP Physics C: E&M to take

PHYS 145.Title: Elementary Particle Physics
Reviews: It's particle physics, what can you expect.
Better than E&M, but not fab

PSYCH 16.Title: Developmental Psychology
Reviews: Pretty interesting, and applicable as well.
A must take!!

PSYCH 975.Title: Contemporary Issues in Psychology
Reviews: This is juuust right
A bit overhyped ngl...
Very low workload, no exams

PSYCH 1005.Title: Health: A Positive Psychology Perspective
Reviews: Very interesting take on a classic psychology class.
A LOT of time, but definitely so worth it

REL 116.Title: The Conduct of Life in Western and Eastern Philosophy
Reviews: Good and painless way to satisfy the humanities requirement.
Amazing class!

SPAN 10.Title: Beginning Spanish
Reviews: So well-taught and streamlined
I LOVED this class!!
A LOT of time, but definitely so worth it

SPAN 61PH.Title: Spanish for Public Health
Reviews: Great class, but lotteried.
Not too much work but is super interesting

SOCSTUD 60.Title: Making Sense of Methods for Theoretical and Historical Research
Reviews: Take this course!!!

SOCSTUD 98TD.Title: The Theory and Practice of Democracy in the Global South
